meta.englishTitle: Would That You Were Like a Brother to Me
meta.subtitle: The Keruvim: Brothers in Divine Service

blocks.text: מִי יִתֶּנְךָ כְּאָח לִי יוֹנֵק שְׁדֵי אִמִּי אֶמְצָאֲךָ בַחוּץ אֶשָּׁקֶךָ

blocks.label: Ohr Ein Sof
blocks.english: The Infinite Light · Source of All
blocks.tagline: Utterly beyond all worlds—even חכמה עילאה is like nothing before it. "כולא קמיה כלא חשיב"—All is considered as naught before Him.

details.title: The Ten Sefirot as a "Name"
details.content: Even the loftiest Sefirot—including חכמה עילאה—are merely רזא דשמא קדישא (the secret of the Holy Name). Just as a person's name is only an external indication and doesn't touch their true essence, so too the Sefirot are merely a "name" relative to אין סוף.

details.title: He Is the Knower, the Knowledge, and the Known
details.content: הוא היודע והוא הדעה והוא הידוע—Unlike created beings where the knower, knowledge, and known are separate, Hashem is completely unified with His wisdom. This is why חכמה is called אין סוף—through this unity, the Infinite is revealed.

details.title: Ani Hashem Lo Shaniti
details.content: אני ה' לא שניתי—"I Hashem have not changed." The creation of worlds causes no change whatsoever in the Essence. Before creation and after, He remains absolutely the same, for all worlds are as nothing before Him.

blocks.label: Chochmah Ila'ah
blocks.tagline: Called אדם הגדול and אנפי רברבי (great face)—the first vessel where אור אין סוף shines. "ה' בחכמה"—Hashem is revealed through Wisdom.

details.title: Why Torah is Called "Adam"
details.content: The Torah is called אדם ("זאת התורה אדם") because its root is in חכמה עילאה. Just as the brain is the primary vessel for the soul in a human being, חכמה is the primary vessel for אור אין סוף.

details.title: Bitul of Chochmah
details.content: The nature of חכמה is ביטול—nullification. The word חכמה can be read as כח מה—"the power of 'what.'" Because of this total self-nullification, אור אין סוף can rest within it.

details.title: Aihu V'Chiyohi Chad
details.content: איהו וחיוהי חד—"He and His life-forces are one." At the level of חכמה, there is complete unity between the Infinite Light and the vessel, unlike the lower Sefirot where איהו וגרמוהי חד—unity with "vessels."

blocks.label: Torah D'Briah
blocks.tagline: Called כרוב and אנפי זוטרי (small face)—the Torah as it descends through צמצום to be grasped by finite beings. "צמצם שכינתו בין בדי הארון."

details.title: From Infinite to Finite
details.content: For the Infinite Light to be grasped by finite beings, immense צמצום (contraction) is required. Like a great teacher explaining deep concepts to a small child—the essence remains, but contracted to fit the vessel.

details.title: The Secret of Keruv
details.content: כרוב in Aramaic is כרביא—like a child. The Keruvim had the faces of children (אנפי זוטרי) because they represent the divine light in its contracted form, accessible to created beings.

details.title: Tzimtzum Shechinat Between the Staves
details.content: The Shechinah was "contracted" between the staves of the Ark—not because Hashem is limited, but to enable revelation to finite beings. Every revelation requires corresponding concealment.

blocks.text: The Two Keruvim: Brothers in Service

items.description: Represents Z"A—the flow from Above to below, source of light to the worlds.
items.detail: This Keruv represents זעיר אנפין דאצילות—the drawing down (המשכה) of divine light from above to below. It is the source and root for the flow of light into בריאה-יצירה-עשיה. Like a parent bestowing gifts upon a child.

items.description: Represents Nukvah/Malchut—the root of Jewish souls ascending to Hashem.
items.detail: This Keruv represents מלכות דאצילות, the root of נשמות ישראל. It is the ascent (העלאה) from below to above—our yearning for כלות הנפש to cleave to Hashem. "עינינו נשואות אל ה'."

blocks.title: Faces Toward Each Other: The Dynamic of Service
blocks.intro: "ופניהם איש אל אחיו"—Their faces were toward each other. When is this achieved?

items.content: Awakening from Below: Through קריאת שמע—contemplating how "ה' אחד" and that all worlds are as nothing before Him—one reaches מסירות נפש באחד. This triggers the response from above.
Awakening from Above: "כמים הפנים לפנים"—as water reflects a face, so too Hashem responds to our love with His love. When we yearn upward, divine light flows downward.
Face to Face: This is the state of the Keruvim when both awakenings meet—like at מתן תורה where "פנים בפנים דבר ה' עמכם." At this level, they are called אחים—brothers.

blocks.text: The Wings: Ascending Through Love and Fear

blocks.label: Kanfei HaKeruvim
blocks.tagline: "והיו הכרובים פורשי כנפים למעלה"—Three times daily, the Keruvim spread their wings and ascend. These wings are אהבה ויראה—love and fear.

details.title: Wings to Fly Above
details.content: The Zohar teaches: אהבה ויראה נקראים גדפין לפרחא לעילא—love and fear are called "wings to fly above." Without them, the soul cannot ascend. They are awakened through the three daily prayers.

details.title: Ascending to Atzilut
details.content: Three times daily, through תפלה, the Keruvim ascend from בריאה-יצירה-עשיה to אצילות. At that moment, they become אדם הגדול and אנפי רברבי—because in Atzilut, איהו וחיוהי וגרמוהי חד בהון.

details.title: Tefillah as Connection
details.content: תפלה means חיבור—connection, like נפתולי אלקים נפתלתי. Through prayer, we connect and unite with our source in אצילות. The Keruvim spreading their wings is the inner meaning of this connection.

blocks.label: The Kapores
blocks.tagline: "מן הכפורת תעשו את הכרובים"—The Keruvim were made from the Kapores itself. This represents סובב כל עלמין—the encompassing light that surrounds both equally.

details.title: Encompassing Light
details.content: סובב כל עלמין is the divine light beyond gradation—it surrounds all worlds equally, without distinction between high and low. This is why the Kapores, which represents this light, encompasses both Keruvim.

details.title: Source of All Creation
details.content: The ultimate source of all creation is the אור המקיף. The Keruvim—representing the entire system of descent and ascent—emerge from this single source, symbolized by being hewn from the same piece of gold as the Kapores.

details.title: Beyond Distinctions
details.content: At the level of סובב, all distinctions dissolve. ז"א and נוקבא, drawing down and ascending, are equal before the Infinite. This is why the Kapores "covers" them both equally.

blocks.text: יונק שדי אמי: The Nursing Mother of Torah

rows.written: מוסר אביך — Father's Teaching: Like the seed from the father, concentrated and hidden
rows.oral: תורת אמך — Mother's Torah: Like the mother who develops and reveals the full form

rows.written: חכמה (Chochmah) — Brief, allusive, the point of insight
rows.oral: בינה (Binah) — Expanded, explained, understanding in depth

rows.written: The mitzvot are hinted at briefly—we know what to do but not all the details
rows.oral: The full revelation of how to fulfill each mitzvah with all its particulars

rows.written: Like bread—essential nourishment but limited pleasure
rows.oral: Like wine that "gladdens God and man"—the delight comes from understanding

blocks.title: Milk and the Growth of the Soul
blocks.intro: "יונק שדי אמי"—Nursing from the mother. The Torah's wisdom is compared to milk that grows the infant soul.

items.content: Just as milk grows the infant's physical body and develops the brain until the child can speak and walk, so too Torah שבעל פה grows the 248 spiritual "limbs" of the soul—the 10 Sefirot times 10, times 10, with their root in the 5 חסדים.
"אשרי מי שבא לכאן ותלמודו בידו"—Happy is one who comes to the World to Come with their learning in hand. The Torah learned in this world enables the soul to receive the revelations of גן עדן.
The main תענוג (delight) from learning comes specifically in בינה—when one truly understands the matter thoroughly. This is "יין המשמח"—the wine that gladdens.

blocks.text: אמצאך בחוץ: Finding Hashem in the Marketplace

blocks.label: Baalei Esek
blocks.english: Business People · Birurim in the World
blocks.tagline: "אמצאך בחוץ"—I will find You outside. Even those who cannot constantly study Torah can achieve the level of "כאח לי" through their worldly work of elevating ניצוצות.

details.title: Hashem's Acquisition
details.content: "קונה שמים וארץ"—Hashem "acquires" heaven and earth. Like a purchase where one gives money and receives goods, the six days of work are the "payment" and Shabbos is the "acquisition"—the elevation of all the sparks refined during the week.

details.title: Elevating Through Echad
details.content: When the businessman says "ה' אחד" with intention in קריאת שמע—even just the first verse which requires כוונה according to all opinions—all his worldly dealings are elevated to the "אחד." This fulfills "ואספת דגנך."

details.title: The Advantage of Iskafia
details.content: יתרון האור מן החושך—The advantage of light from darkness. The אתכפיא (self-subduing) of business people who overcome their distractions to pray and study reaches higher than the service of those who sit and learn without such struggles.

blocks.label: Yein HaRekach
blocks.tagline: "אשקך מיין הרקח"—I will give you spiced wine. The Torah study of those who overcome challenges has both "taste" (understanding) and "fragrance" (reaching transcendent levels).

details.title: Fragrance from the Supernal
details.content: ריח (fragrance) comes from the מקיף—the encompassing, transcendent level. Unlike food which the body enjoys, fragrance is enjoyed by the נשמה itself. The אתכפיא of business people reaches this level.

details.title: Wine Plus Spices
details.content: Regular wine has taste—like בינה, the understanding one gains. יין הרקח (spiced wine) has both taste and fragrance—the קביעות עתים of busy people contains both inner light and transcendent light.

details.title: Neshikin—The Kiss
details.content: For business people it says "אשקך"—I will kiss you. נשיקין is אתדבקות רוחא ברוחא—spiritual cleaving. Through their self-sacrifice, they achieve a level of connection even higher than constant Torah study.

blocks.text: The Three Pillars That Sustain the World

items.description: The middle pillar—קו האמצעי—drawing from Keter through Tiferes.
items.detail: Torah study draws down אור אין סוף through the middle line. When we say "קוינו לו"—we drew Him into קוין—Torah is the central pillar connecting all levels.

items.description: The left pillar—קו השמאל—elevating through Gevurah.
items.detail: Prayer (עבודה שבלב) is the service of the heart. It represents the ascent, the רצוא, the yearning upward. "עולת תמיד"—constant elevation.

items.description: The right pillar—קו הימין—flowing through Chesed.
items.detail: Acts of kindness draw down divine Chesed into the world. This includes charity (צדקה) which business people excel in through their earnings. It is the שוב, the return and bestowal.

blocks.text: Shabbos: The Completion of the Week

blocks.label: Yom HaShevi'i
blocks.english: The Seventh Day · Elevation of All
blocks.tagline: "ויכולו השמים"—from כלתה נפשי—yearning of the soul. On Shabbos, all the בירורים of the week ascend to their source. "לכה דודי לקראת כלה."

details.title: Six Days of Descent
details.content: During the six weekdays, the מדות עליונות descend into בריאה-יצירה-עשיה to enable the work of בירור. Each day corresponds to one of the six מדות—from חסד on Sunday to יסוד on Friday.

details.title: The Seventh Day—Ascent
details.content: On Shabbos, everything returns and ascends to its source. This is the מדה השביעית—מלכות. The sparks refined through the week's work now rise up, and we say "קונה שמים וארץ"—the acquisition is complete.

details.title: Kallah—The Bride
details.content: כלה means both "bride" and כלות הנפש—expiration of the soul in yearning for Hashem. "ויכלו" hints that on Shabbos, all existence yearns to return to and be absorbed in its divine source.

blocks.text: מעסיס רמוני: Even the "Empty" Are Full

blocks.content:
"מעסיס רמוני"—from the juice of my pomegranates. This refers to those who cannot study Torah at all, but are filled with mitzvos like a pomegranate is filled with seeds.
The Sages teach: "אפילו ריקנים שבך מלאים מצות כרמון"—even the empty ones among you are full of mitzvos like a pomegranate. ריקנים doesn't mean sinners—it means those "empty" of Torah learning, but full of mitzvos and דרך ארץ.
Mitzvos also awaken the תענוג העליון because "נעוץ תחלתן בסופן"—the end (physical action) is rooted in the beginning (supernal pleasure). Physical mitzvos, though they seem "lowest," reach the highest source.

blocks.title: After the Churban: How We Become Brothers Now
blocks.intro: When the Beis HaMikdash stood, the Keruvim revealed the unity of Israel and Hashem. After the destruction, how do we achieve this?

items.content: The Keruvim Were Hidden: The Shechinah journeyed "from Keruv to Keruv" as it departed. The revelation that once shone through the physical Keruvim withdrew to its spiritual source in אצילות.
Four Amos of Halachah: "משחרב בית המקדש אין לו להקב"ה אלא ד' אמות של הלכה"—After the destruction, Hashem's presence rests specifically in Torah study. This becomes our new "Beis HaMikdash."

The Yearning for Brotherhood: This is the request of כנסת ישראל in exile—"Would that You be like a brother to me, as in the days of the Temple when we were called אחים and faced each other פנים בפנים!"
